abstract: d Salzgitter, a German steel company, has dropped out of talks to buy a Canadian rival, Algoma Steel, after word of the secret negotiations leaked, driving up the price of a takeover and piquing the interest of other potential suitors. While Salzgitter has walked away four weeks after starting talks, there are other “interested parties” that surfaced after news of the Salzgitter discussions became public last month, Algoma said Tuesday, adding that it plans to enter into negotiations with them in hopes of salvaging a sale.
lead_paragraph: d Salzgitter, a German steel company, has dropped out of talks to buy a Canadian rival, Algoma Steel, after word of the secret negotiations leaked, driving up the price of a takeover and piquing the interest of other potential suitors. While Salzgitter has walked away four weeks after starting talks, there are other “interested parties” that surfaced after news of the Salzgitter discussions became public last month, Algoma said Tuesday, adding that it plans to enter into negotiations with them in hopes of salvaging a sale.

headline.main: Algoma Loses One Suitor, but Sees Others on the Horizon
